name: Azhagu Kutti Chellam
synopsis: Azhagu Kutti Chellam (English: Cute, little baby) is a 2016 Tamil film written and directed by Charles. The film features an ensemble cast including Akhil, Karunas, Suresh and John Vijay, while Ved Shankar composes the film's music. Having been in the making since 2013, the film released on 1 January 2016.

name: Maalai Nerathu Mayakkam
synopsis: Maalai Nerathu Mayakkam is a Tamil romance film directed by Gitanjali Selvaraghavan and written by Selvaraghavan. Featuring newcomers Balakrishna Kola and Wamiqa Gabbi, the film is produced by Kola Bhaskar and has music composed by Amrit. Having had several false starts since 2006, the film released on 1 January 2016 to positive reviews.[1][2]

name: Peigal Jaakkirathai
synopsis: Peigal Jaakkirathai (English: Beware of ghosts!) is an Indian Tamil horror comedy film, written and directed by Kanmani. The film features Jeeva Rathnam and Eshanya in the lead roles, while Thambi Ramaiah, Rajendran and John Vijay in supporting roles. Featuring music composed by Maria Jerald, Peigal Jaakkirathai released on 1 January 2016.

name: Tharkappu
synopsis: Tharkappu is a 2016 Tamil action thriller movie directed by R.P. Ravi and produced by S. Selvamuthu and Manjunath. The film features Shakthi Vasudevan and Samuthirakani, both in leading roles. The film's original soundtrack has been composed by F. S. Faizal, while the film released on 1 January 2016.[1]

name: Gethu
synopsis: Gethu (English: Flamboyant)[1] is a 2016 Tamil crime-action film written and directed by Thirukumaran. Produced by Udhayanidhi Stalin, the film features himself in the lead role along with Amy Jackson, while Sathyaraj and Vikranth portray supporting roles. Featuring music composed by Harris Jayaraj and cinematography by Sukumar, the film was released on 14 January 2016. It received mixed reviews. [2]

name: Kathakali
synopsis: Kathakali is a 2016 Tamil action-thriller film directed by Pandiraj, starring Vishal and Catherine Tresa in the lead roles.[2] Co-produced by both Pandiraj and Vishal, Kathakali released on 14 January 2016. The Telugu dubbed version with the same title was released on 18 March 2016.

name: Rajini Murugan
synopsis: Rajini Murugan is a 2016 Indian Tamil-language comedy-drama film written and directed by Ponram, in his second venture after Varuthapadatha Valibar Sangam (2013). The film has Sivakarthikeyan and Soori in the lead roles, while Keerthi Suresh , Rajkiran and Samuthirakani play supporting roles. The film, produced by Thirrupathi Brothers, features music composed by D. Imman and cinematography by Balasubramaniem.[1] Having gone through significant production delays, the film released on 14 January 2016.

name: Tharai Thappattai
synopsis: Tharai Thappattai (தாரை தப்பட்டை) is a 2016 Tamil musical action drama film written, produced and directed by Bala. The film features Sasikumar and Varalaxmi Sarathkumar in the leading roles, while Ilaiyaraaja composes the film's music based on karakattam. This film also happens to be Ilaiyaraaja's 1000th film. The film began production in 2013 and released on 14 January 2016.[1]

name: Moondraam Ullaga Por
producer:
T. R. S Anbu
V. Sures Narayan
synopsis: Moondraam Ullaga Por (English: Third World War) is a 2016 Indian Tamil war film written and directed by Sugan Kartthi. The film stars Sunil Kumar and Akhila Kishore in the lead roles, with cinematography handled by Dheva, edits by Richard and music composed by Ved Shankar.[1]

name: Aranmanai 2
synopsis: Aranmanai 2 is a 2016 Tamil horror comedy film written and directed by Sundar C. The film stars Sundar C himself, Siddharth, Trisha, Hansika Motwani, Soori, Kovai Sarala and Manobala will be seen in leading roles and with Vaibhav Reddy in a guest appearance. A stand-alone sequel to the successful 2014 film Aranmanai, the film released on 29 January 2016.There will be Aranmanai 3. The film received mixed reviews from critics for using same scenes and revenge drama from Aranmanai. Despite this, it received positive reviews from the audience and had a very good opening in box office. This flim declared a "Super Hit" at box office.[1] The film was dubbed in Telugu and released under the title Kalavathi.

name: Bangalore Naatkal
synopsis: Bangalore Naatkal (English: Bangalore Days) is an Indian Tamil comedy drama film directed by Bommarillu Bhaskar, which is a remake of the 2014 Malayalam film Bangalore Days written and directed by Anjali Menon. Featuring an ensemble cast consisting of Arya, Sri Divya, and Bobby Simha in the lead roles, it tells the story of three cousins who live their childhood dream of living and enjoying in the city of Bangalore. It also stars Rana Daggubati, Raai Laxmi, Parvathy and Samantha Ruth Prabhu in other pivotal roles. Produced by Prasad V Potluri under his banner PVP cinema, the film released on 5 February 2016.

name: Sethu Boomi
music_director:
V. T. Bharathi
V. T. Monish
synopsis: Sethu Boomi is an Indian Tamil drama film, written and directed by Kenthiran Muniasami. The film features Thaman Kumar and Samskruthy Shenoy in the lead roles, while Kenthiran Muniasami, Junior Balaiah and Singampuli in supporting roles. Featuring music composed by , Sethu Boomi released on 5 February 2016.[1]

name: Visaranai
synopsis: Visaranai (English: Interrogation) is a 2015 Indian Tamil thriller film written and directed by Vetrimaaran based on the novel Lock Up by M. Chandrakumar. Featuring Dinesh, Anandhi and Aadukalam Murugadoss in the lead roles, the film deals with police brutality, corruption, and loss of innocence in the face of injustice.

name: Anjala
synopsis: Anjala is an 2016 Tamil film directed by Thangam Saravanan and produced by Dhilip Subbarayan. Vimal and Nandita feature in the leading roles, while Gopi Sunder composes the film's music.[1]

name: Jil Jung Juk
synopsis: Jil Jung Juk (English: The Good, The Average, The Unworthy) is a 2016 Indian Tamil western comedy film directed by Deeraj Vaidy, starring Siddharth, Avinash Raghudevan and Sananth Reddy in the leading roles. This will be the 25th all films of Siddharth. Originally set to release on 25 December 2015, the film was postponed to 2016 due to the crew's efforts in assisting victims of the Chennai floodings. The first half of the film was good, second half was little dragged.

name: Vil Ambu
synopsis: Vil Ambu is an Indian Tamil-language thriller film written and directed by Ramesh Subramaniam and presented by Suseenthiran. The film features Sri, Harish Kalyan, Samskruthy Shenoy, Srushti Dange and Chandini Tamilarasan in the leading roles, while Harish Uthaman plays a pivotal supporting role.[1] The film, featuring music by Navin, will release in February 2016.[2]

name: Miruthan
synopsis: Miruthan is a 2016 Indian Tamil science fiction zombie thriller film written and directed by Shakti Soundar Rajan. The film stars Jayam Ravi and Lakshmi Menon in the leading roles.[2] Advertised as India's first zombie film in Tamil, Miruthan was released on 19 February 2016 and met with critical acclaim, becoming a box office success.

name: Navarasa Thilagam
synopsis: Navarasa Thilagam is an Indian Tamil comedy film directed by Kamran, starring Ma Ka Pa Anand and Srushti Dange in the lead roles. Produced by Sudharshan Vembatty, the film began production in early 2015 and will release in February 2016.

name: Aarathu Sinam
synopsis: Aarathu Sinam (English: Anger won't subside) is a Tamil crime-thriller film written and directed by Arivazhagan and produced by Sri Thenandal Films. A remake of Jeethu Joseph's Malayalam film Memories (2013), the film stars Arulnithi, Aishwarya Rajesh and Aishwarya Dutta in the leading roles. Featuring music composed by Thaman and Cinematography by Aravinnd Singh the film began production during November 2015 and released in February 2016.

name: Kanithan
synopsis: Kanithan (English: Mathematician) is a Tamil action thriller film written and directed by T N Santhosh and produced by S Thanu. The film features Atharvaa and Catherine Tresa in the lead roles, while Sivamani composes the film's music. Having begun production in 2013, the film was released in February 2016. This film receiving positive reviews from critics.

name: Nayyapudai
synopsis: Nayyapudai is a 2016 Tamil drama film directed by Vijay Kiran. The film stars S. A. Chandrasekhar, Pa. Vijay and Chandini Tamilarasan in the leading roles. The film began production during November 2015, and was released in February 2016.[1]

name: Pichaikkaran
synopsis: Pichaikkaran (English: Beggar) is a 2016 Indian Tamil action thriller film directed by Sasi, starring Vijay Antony in the lead role.[1][2][3] The film released on 4 March 2016.

name: Pokkiri Raja
producer:
P. T. Selvakumar
T. S. Ponselvi
synopsis: Pokkiri Raja (The Rogue King) is a 2016 Tamil supernatural comedy film directed by Ramprakash Rayappa, starring Jiiva, Sibiraj and Hansika Motwani in the leading roles.[1]

name: Aviyal
director:
Alphonse Putharen
Shameer Sultan
Mohit Mehra
Lokesh Kanagaraj
Guru Smaran
synopsis: Aviyal is an independent Tamil anthology film written and directed by six directors such as Alphonse Putharen, Shameer Sultan, Mohit Mehra, Lokesh Kanagaraj and Guru Smaran. Actors including Nivin Pauly, Bobby Simha and Arjunan Nandakumar have featured in the short films included in the anthology. Produced by Karthik Subbaraj's Stone Bench Creations, it is the second venture after Bench Talkies - The First Bench (2015).[1]

name: Kadhalum Kadandhu Pogum
synopsis: Kadhalum Kadanthu Pogum (Meaning: Love too shall pass) is an Indian Tamil-language romantic comedy-drama film written and directed by Nalan Kumarasamy. Produced by C. V. Kumar under Thirukumaran Entertainment banner, the film stars Vijay Sethupathi and Madonna Sebastian in the lead roles.[2] The film is an official remake of the 2010 Korean film My Dear Desperado which was already remade in Hindi in 2013 as Jayantabhai Ki Luv Story. The film released on 11 March 2016 [3]with positive reviews from critics and became a box office hit. [4]

name: Natpadhigaram 79
synopsis: Natpadhigaram 79 is an upcoming Indian Tamil language film written and directed by Ravichandran. The film features Raj Bharath, Amzath Khan, Reshmi Menon and Tejaswi Madivada in the leading roles, with Deepak Nilambur composing the film's music.[1]

name: Pugazh
synopsis: Pugazh (English: Fame) (Tamil:புகழ்) is a 2016 Indian Tamil language action drama film written and directed by Manimaran and co-produced by Varun Manian. The film features Jai and Surabhi in the leading roles, with Vivek-Mervin composing the film's music.[1] The film was released on 18 March 2016.

name: Sawaari
actors:
Benito FranklinSanam Shetty
Karthik Yogi
Mathivanan Rajendran

name: Vidayutham
actors:
Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar
Ram Saravanan
Nagamaneci
synopsis: Vidayutham is an upcoming Tamil film directed by Nagamaneci. The film unfolds us through a journey where one faces the consequence when two people meet each other.[1] The film features Oscar-winning movie the Slumdog Millionaire Child Artist Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar[2] First Time As Heroine In Tamil,other cast includes Kaushik ram(one of the hero) who played a child artist role in the movie azhagi(Tamil) And Director Nagamaneci Itself Playing A Important Lead Role. This Film Is Produced BY Sree Nagaraja Sarpayaakshi Films And Nagamaneci Entertainments Private Ltd.Audio Was launched at Nov 27 2015. Music Label Naga B Music.Movie Released on 18th March 2016[1]

name: Adida Melam
synopsis: Adida Melam is an upcoming Indian Tamil Romantic comedy film directed by Anbu Stalin featuring newcomer Nischala Krishnan and Abhinaya in the lead roles.[1] Despite being launched in 2012, the film went through production troubles and subsequently had a name change from Mela Thaalam to Adida Melam in 2016.[2][3]

name: Vaaliba Raja
synopsis: Vaaliba Raja is an Indian 2016 Tamil comedy film. It was directed by Sai Gokul Ramanath and produced by Murali. The film features Sethu, Vishakha Singh and Nushrat Bharucha in the leading roles, while Santhanam also essays a pivotal role.[1] The film began production in June 2013 and was released on March 25, 2016.[2]

name: Ennul Aayiram
synopsis: Ennul Aayiram is an upcoming Indian Tamil comedy drama film written and directed by Krishna Kumar. The film features newcomers Maha and Marina Michael in the lead roles, while Vincent Asokan and Krishnamoorthy play supporting roles. Featuring music composed by Gopi Sunder, the film began production in early 2015.[1]

name: Narathan
producer:
Vetrivel Film International
The Principal India
Sajith V Nambiar
synopsis: Narathan is an upcoming Tamil film directed by Naga Venkatesh and produced by Vetrivel Film International - Selvakumar, The Principal India, Sajith V Nambiar. Nakul, Nikesha Patel and Premgi Amaren feature in the leading roles, while Mani Sharma composes the film's music.[1]

name: Uyire Uyire
synopsis: Uyire Uyire is an upcoming Tamil film directed by A. Rajasekhar and produced by veteran actress Jaya Prada and former politician Amar Singh. The film, a remake of Vikram Kumar's 2012 Telugu film Ishq, features Jaya Prada's son Siddhu and Hansika Motwani in the lead roles. The film is currently in production.

name: Idhu Namma Aalu
synopsis: Idhu Namma Aalu (English: That's my Girl) is an upcoming Tamil romantic comedy film written and directed by Pandiraj. The film features Silambarasan, Nayantara and Andrea Jeremiah in the lead roles, while Soori and Jayaprakash portray supporting roles. Produced by T. Rajender and featuring music by Kuralarasan, the film has been in production since 2013.

name: Theri
synopsis: Theri (English: Spark)[3] is an upcoming Indian Tamil action film written and directed by Atlee and produced by Kalaipuli S. Thanu. The film features Vijay, Samantha and Amy Jackson in the lead roles, while Prabhu and Raadhika Sarathkumar amongst others form an ensemble cast. Featuring music composed by G. V. Prakash Kumar and cinematography handled by George C. Williams, Theri will have a theatrical release in 2016.

name: Vetrivel
synopsis: Vetrivel is an upcoming Tamil film written and directed by Vasantha Mani. The film features M. Sasikumar and Miya George in the lead roles. The film's music will be composed by D. Imman and the cinematography is handled by S. R. Kathir.[1][2]

name: Amma Kanakku
synopsis: Amma Kanakku is an upcoming Indian Tamil drama film written and directed by Ashwini Iyer Tiwari. A remake of the 2016 Hindi film Nil Battey Sannata, the film stars Amala Paul, Revathi and Samuthirakani in the lead roles. Principal photography of the film commenced on 7 January 2016 in Chennai.[1]
24 is an upcoming Indian Tamil-language science fiction action[2] film, written and directed by Vikram Kumar. The film stars Suriya, Samantha and Nithya Menen.

name: Manithan
synopsis: Manithan is an upcoming Tamil comedy courtroom comedy drama film directed by I. Ahmed, starring Udhayanidhi Stalin, Hansika Motwani and Prakash Raj in the leading roles. A remake of Subhash Kapoor's 2013 Hindi film Jolly LLB, the film began production in June 2015.

name: Bruce Lee
synopsis: Bruce Lee is an upcoming Tamil action-comedy film directed by Prashanth Pandiraj, starring G. V. Prakash Kumar and Kriti Kharbanda in the leading roles, the film being the latter's first straight Tamil film. The film began production during July 2015 and will release in 2016.[2][3]
